title: Soursop Production Techniques- A training for Belize

subtasks: Collect pollen grain from male flowers
Transfer pollen grain to stigma of female flower using a brush

tasks.task: Protecting developing fruits from seed borers
subtasks: Identify seed borer attack risk period (after 60 days of pollination)
Apply protective bags to fruits during vulnerable stage (2-3 months after pollination)

tasks.task: Pruning soursop trees for optimal growth and yield
subtasks: Remove excess branches and central branches to improve air circulation and sunlight penetration
Regularly maintain tree structure to facilitate pollination, spray application, and harvesting
Encourage flower bud formation by pruning appropriately
Assess ripeness through skin color changes and easy detachment from stalk
Use shears to cut fruit near the stalk, leaving the latter attached to the tree
Promote continuous flowering by harvesting strategically and pruning to stimulate new flower sites
Incorporate leaf and branch trimmings under tree canopy
Use compost and biofertilizers to enrich soil while managing weed growth
Dispose of fruits away from the tree canopy to prevent diseases like anthracnose
